newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian firm wins order to fly elephants to Africa.
newsitem.headline: Russian firm wins order to fly elephants to Africa.

text.p: A Russian airline has won an order to export elephants to Uganda later this year, a company official said on Monday.

Marina Samokhvalova, cargo manager of TransCharter, said the firm had been chosen by British-based Aircraft Management Services to transport four to six elephants from St Petersburg zoo to the Ugandan capital Kampala.
She said the elephants would be used in the making of a BBC documentary film.
Samokhvalova did not say why the British Broadcasting Corporation had decided to send elephants from Russia to an African country.
The elephants will be transported in containers on an Antonov An-124 jet in September, she said.
